summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackGood Molecules Gentle Retinol Cream is a gentle treatment to help soften the look of fine lines and wrinkles.
details: DetailsFeaturesNourishing, soothing ingredients help to hydrate and minimize dryness and irritation.Key IngredientsFormulated with 0.1% retinol, an effective concentration for softening the look of fine lines and wrinklesAntioxidant-rich bakuchiol boosts the effects of retinol without irritationGrapeseed oil, allantoin, and acmella oleracea extract help nourish and soothe skinItem 2589110How To UseFor sensitive skin or dry skin types: Use up to 3x weekly at night. For normal skin types: Use up to 4x weekly at night. Apply a pea-sized amount to cleansed skin after serums. Wear SPF during the day when using this product. Avoid contact with eyes. If irritation or redness occurs, discontinue use.IngredientsWater, C13-16 Isoparaffin, Glycerin, Diheptyl Succinate, Heptyl Undecylenate, 1,2-hexanediol, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate/vp Copolymer, Polyglyceryl-10 Oleate, Propanediol, Vitis Vinifera, (Grape) Seed Oil, Caprylic/capric Triglyceride, Bakuchiol, Tocopherol, Acmella Oleracea Extract, Butylene Glycol, Retinol, Allantoin, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Capryloyl Glycerin/sebacic Acid Copolymer, Ethylhexylglycerin, Salix Alba (Willow) Bark Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Lilium Candidum Bulb Extract.
how_to_use: For sensitive skin or dry skin types: Use up to 3x weekly at night. For normal skin types: Use up to 4x weekly at night. Apply a pea-sized amount to cleansed skin after serums. Wear SPF during the day when using this product. Avoid contact with eyes. If irritation or redness occurs, discontinue use.

reviews.headline: New version is nothing like the old one
reviews.comments:
I used this retinol cream for nearly a year (and swore by it) and it worked well for my skinâ€”until recently, when i could swear GM quietly changed the formula and packaging. Not only does the new version smell HORRIBLE, but it caused me to have a severe breakout and what I believe was an allergic reaction. My skin has never reacted this badly to a skincare product before and I know for a fact it is directly linked to using this cream.

It's really disappointing that such a reliable product was altered without any clear notice. The new tube looks different, the texture feels off, (and you can definitely tell by the smell) and unfortunately, the results are the complete opposite of what I experienced before. I won't be repurchasing, and I'd caution others who had success with the old formula to be very careful with this new one!!

reviews.headline: Wouldn't be Without this Retinol Cream
reviews.comments: After using this Retinol Cream for several weeks I was pleasantly surprised to notice sun damage (pigmentation) was fading on my face and lines/wrinkles (sigh) were also softened and less noticeable. This is an effective, affordable product!

reviews.headline: Disappointing
reviews.comments: I am not a beginner in case of retinols. This doesnt work for me. Probably it is too gentle for my 30 yr old face lol. The thrill to discover something so reasonably priced went away after using an entire tube only to find no difference.

reviews.headline: Don't buy unless you want to break out.
reviews.comments: I started breaking out within four days of using and I thought I was just purging. Continued to use it for three more weeks and my breakouts never slowed down. I stopped using it tor a week to see if my face just needed a break. It looked a little better, and i tried it last night and have two huge enormous new blemishes.  Do. Not. Use.  Check out reddit for more people with my experience.

reviews.headline: sensitive skin
reviews.comments: I have sensitive skin prone to breaking out in a rash, but this was definitely gentle enough for my skin. I'm 35, pale, struggle with rosecea and some acne and have mild signs of aging and sun damage. I use this about 3-4 times a week with zero problems. I use a scentless basic hydrating moisturizer after and in the morning I use a salicylic acid and aloe gel and a rose infused moisturizer and havent had any issues. ther w were some minor breakouts at first, but ive read thats normal.

reviews.headline: On my 4th purchase of this!
reviews.comments: So I've tried so many retinol creams and serums and I can easily say this one is my absolute favorite! And for that price! It's so gentle and doesn't make my skin react, not even in winter when my skin is already dry. It keeps my skin looking bouncy and bright. I use azaleic acid in the morning, and this at night, and it keeps my skin acne free! I have had many two pimples in the last 6 months. Genuinely can't recommend this product enough!

reviews.headline: Great for hormonal acne
reviews.comments: this does not dry out your skin , it also helps acne scars and any acne that forms disappear over night !

reviews.headline: Perfect for beginners or sensitive skin
reviews.comments: I've tried a couple different times to incorporate retinols into my skincare routine but I have INCREDIBLY sensitive skin. Each time I tried my skin would break out into an irritated rash and become super damaged in just one or two uses. I saw this one claimed to be gentle and it was super affordable so I gave it a try and its worked great! I had to incorporate it very slowly over a few weeks into my skincare routine but now I can apply it almost nightly with no problems. And my skin definitely looks brighter and I've noticed some of my fine lines and scars have faded a bit after using it now for about 6 months. At such an affordable price point, this product is definitely worth a shot for people trying to use retinol for the first time or people with ultra sensitive skin like me.

reviews.headline: my fav retinol!
reviews.comments: i had issues with it at first, but because i was using a serum with it that wasnt compatible. once i got a good routine down, i was able to see a major difference in my skin! im able to use this every night with no irritation and my acne & texture have cleared up significantly < 3 im in the middle of my second tube (with a third already in my backups) its the most affordable retinol ive found & i will continue to repurchase!!!

reviews.headline: HOLY GRAILðŸ™ŒðŸ»
reviews.comments: I absolutely love this retinol cream! I'm on my 3rd tube, and I plan on continuing to buy it. It is perfect for my skin (oily/combo). This would be an amazing beginner retinol, especially for the price, and IT WORKS. When it says it's gentle, it's not lying. It doesn't burn, break me out, irritate, strip, or dry out my skin. I tried a stronger retinol serum/emulsion, and it completely broke me out in one use and nearly ruined my hard work I've put into my skin over the last couple years. Learned my lesson and immediately went back to this, and I don't plan on straying ever again! Loooove it and Good Molecules!

reviews.headline: Great cream.
reviews.comments: This has helped my post acne scars as well as preventing new acne. Face looks better! It is very gentle, no reaction. It does have an off putting smell but not a deal breaker.

reviews.headline: Great for beginners!
reviews.comments: I have been trying to incorporate more retinol in my nightly routines and this is great for beginners! It is definitely gentle on my skin and I have a combination skin type.

reviews.headline: Works better than Prescription
reviews.comments: A dermatologist told me to try this before paying 5x's more for the prescription. Best advice, ever. It will cause dryness like the script but I mix in a drop Buxom oil and moisturizer Am & Pm. 2 months later skin looks fabulous. Oh SPF in SM!!

reviews.headline: Good for smile lines
reviews.comments: used this for about 2 weeks and noticed a positive difference. HOWEVER, I put this cream in my under eyes thinking it might help and they got worse, irritated and flaky (instructions say don't apply near eyes so maybe it was my fault)

reviews.headline: GOOD!!
reviews.comments: I am very acne prone even tho im 15 i been having acne since i was 12 . I been left with red acne scars so i tried everything i could snd it seems to not get better so i gave this retinol a try. The first time i appiled it , it didnt sting or cause redness with is a good thing for me because i also have sensitive skin. Its to early to see results but i hope it works for me

reviews.headline: buy it , very affordable
reviews.comments: listen  all I got say is im really picky,  and good molecules is so good . And this good amazing with moisturizer  i love it this my 5th time buying it.

reviews.headline: I would buy again
reviews.comments:
I recently started using this product, every other day, 2 weeks today to be exact , I can see results. 
My skin is brighter, smoother and I notice my pores are tighter.

reviews.headline: Packaging is not great
reviews.comments: I like the retinol product itself, I have noticed it really helping with some discoloration and it is not too harsh which is great. However, the packaging is, in my opinion, terrible. Once you get down to less than half the product left, the material is so stiff that it hurrs my fingers to try and squeeze out. I am going to have to cut into it in order to get all of the product out. This makes me not want to repurchase. The product for the price is good but the packaging is so annoying that I was motivated to write a review dedicated to it.

reviews.headline: I have bought this 3 times now!
reviews.comments: As a43 year old, I've started noticing dark spots on my cheeks and forehead, but using this cream, every other night has lightened them up a huge amount! Now I've bought a bottle for my 19 year old daughter because she insists on tanning and has a few spots on her face. This cream will absolutely help her too! Love it

reviews.headline: Great retinol cream
reviews.comments: Really gentle and does what it's supposed to do. I have been using this for more than 6 months now and I will keep buying it.

properties.name: Cons

values.label: It has a little bit of a weird plasticy smell

display_values: It has a little bit of a weird plasticy smell

media.headline: Good product for the price
media.caption: For not using it daily..and taking some breaks in-between I can def see changes in the wrinkles by my eyes and skin texture

media.headline: Packaging is a nightmare
media.caption: Hard to dig product out and makes a mess

faceoff_positive.comments: I want to start this by saying everyone has different skin so what works for me might not necessarily work for someons else. I'm 25 going on 26 come November, and I have very dry, sensitive skin. I recently stopped taking birth control and had a cystic acne breakout the likes of which I havent seen since I was 15. I had huge, deep, painful cystic zits all over my chin, forehead, and cheeks. I kept with my regular skin routine and powerful zit cream for weeks to know avail. I made an appointment with a dermatologist but they couldn't see me for another 2 weeks. At this point I was using so many salicylic acid products that my face was dry and flaky and burned at the touch of even my sensitive skin moisturizer, without the zits so much as shrinking even a little. In a last ditch effort I read up on skincare a bit and decided to try retinol. I read that it can help with acne by purging skin of gunk, meaning it forces you to break out. I figured it cant be any worse than what I got now so I purchased this retinol cream and used it in combination with my regular face wash and toner, the Good Molecules Niacinamide serum, Super Peptide serum, Squalane oil (I read that these go well with retinol), and my regular  moisturizer. The retinol has thin creamg texture making it easy to spread around the skin. I honestly braced myself on first application, expecting it to burn, but I was pleasantly surprised when I didnt feel anything. I noticed a difference in my acne immediately the next morning. The deep cyst like blemishes all had white heads. It has now been a only week of using this routine and my skin is almost totally clear save for the few bigger blemishes on my chin that have now significantly shrunk in size. I am in awe that it worked so well. My dermatologist appointment is now in a few days and i dont even know what Im going to say since the deep what im assuming was hormonal acne, is almost completely gone. My skin feels amazing and has even stopped flaking and burning. I definitely recommend this product, but keep in mind I used it in combination with other products and retinol is more than likely going to cause you to breakout when you first use it because it's bringing gunk to the surface. I used to be a big The Ordinary fan but after this week I think Good Molecules might be my go to from now on!
faceoff_positive.headline: WOW!!!!!!!!

faceoff_negative.comments: I have fallen in love with Good Molecules skincare products since receiving some of their products as a birthday gift. So when I went to place my first ever order I decided to go ahead and give the "Gentle" retinol a try as I've tried a vegan retinol from a different brand that I loved but it's just so expensive and Good Molecules is amazing and affordable skincare.   So I've been using this "Gentle" retinol for the past 3 days and certain areas of my face itch and then my neck is so red and extremely itchy and I've also had a really bad acne breakout on my jawline, cheeks, and forehead.   My nighttime routine consists of a nourishing cleansing balm, a nourishing/plumping mushroom toner, a skin essence, hyaluronic acid serum, then the "Gentle" retinol, a rich moisturizing cream, the good molecules Bakuchiol oil, and then a moisturizing face mist.   I always use sunscreen in the daytime. I tried to use a very very small amount of the "Gentle" retinol on the 3rd day but that did not help at all.   I'm discontinuing using this in my nighttime routine but I'm so so disappointed because it's so affordable and has amazing ingredients.  It just sucks to pay for something even if it didn't cost much and it cause this bad reaction and it's suppose to be "Gentle."
faceoff_negative.headline: dissappointed
